title: Comments on Solutions of Vacuum Superstring Field Theory
abstract: We study classical solutions of vacuum version of Berkovits' superstring field theory, focusing on the (super)ghost sector. We first argue that the supersliver state which is annihilated by eta_0, though it has the correct quantum numbers and solves the equation of motion, is actually non-perturbatively pure-gauge, and hence it fails to describe a D-brane. As a step toward the construction of non-trivial solutions, we calculate e^{-Phi}Qe^{Phi} for twisted superslivers. As a by-product, we find that the bc-twisted sliver solution in bosonic VSFT can, at least formally, also be written as a pure-gauge configuration.
